derivation: a primitive root; also as denominative from H4417 (מֶלַח)
outline:
1. to tear away, dissipate
    1. (Niphal) to be dispersed, be dissipated
  2. to salt, season
    1. (Qal) to salt, season
    2. (Pual) to be salted
    3. (Hophal) to be rubbed or washed with salt
kjv_def: [idiom] at all, salt, season, temper together, vanish away.
strongs_def: properly, to rub to pieces or pulverize; intransitively, to disappear as dust; to salt whether internally (to season with salt) or externally (to rub with salt)
